verses.verse: There is <WH3426> an evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> <WH8804> under the sun <WH8121>, and it is common <WH7227> among men <WH120>:

A man <WH376> to whom 'Elohim <WH430> hath given <WH5414> <WH8799> riches <WH6239>, wealth <WH5233>, and honour <WH3519>, so that he wanteth <WH2638> nothing for his soul <WH5315> of all that he desireth <WH183> <WH8691>, yet 'Elohim <WH430> giveth him not power <WH7980> <WH8686> to eat <WH398> <WH8800> thereof, but a stranger <WH376> <WH5237> eateth <WH398> <WH8799> it: this is vanity <WH1892>, and it is an evil <WH7451> disease <WH2483>.

If a man <WH376> beget <WH3205> <WH8686> an hundred <WH3967> children, and live <WH2421> <WH8799> many <WH7227> years <WH8141>, so that the days <WH3117> of his years <WH8141> be many <WH7227>, and his soul <WH5315> be not filled <WH7646> <WH8799> with good <WH2896>, and also that he have no burial <WH6900>; I say <WH559> <WH8804>, that an untimely birth <WH5309> is better <WH2896> than he.
For he cometh <WH935> <WH8804> in with vanity <WH1892>, and departeth <WH3212> <WH8799> in darkness <WH2822>, and his name <WH8034> shall be covered <WH3680> <WH8792> with darkness <WH2822>.
Moreover he hath not seen <WH7200> <WH8804> the sun <WH8121>, nor known <WH3045> <WH8804> any thing: this <WH2088> hath more rest <WH5183> than <WH2088> the other.

Yea, though <WH432> he live <WH2421> <WH8804> a thousand <WH505> years <WH8141> twice <WH6471> told, yet hath he seen <WH7200> <WH8804> no good <WH2896>: do not all go <WH1980> <WH8802> to one <WH259> place <WH4725> ?
All the labour <WH5999> of man <WH120> is for his mouth <WH6310>, and yet the appetite <WH5315> is not filled <WH4390> <WH8735>.
For what hath the wise <WH2450> more <WH3148> than the fool <WH3684>? what hath the poor <WH6041>, that knoweth <WH3045> <WH8802> to walk <WH1980> <WH8800> before the living <WH2416> ?
Better <WH2896> is the sight <WH4758> of the eyes <WH5869> than the wandering <WH1980> <WH8800> of the desire <WH5315>: this is also vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit <WH7307>.

That which hath been is named <WH7121> <WH8738> <WH8034> already <WH3528>, and it is known <WH3045> <WH8737> that it is man <WH120>: neither may <WH3201> <WH8799> he contend <WH1777> <WH8800> with him that is mightier <WH8623> than he.
Seeing there be <WH3426> many <WH7235> <WH8687> things <WH1697> that increase <WH7235> <WH8688> vanity <WH1892>, what is man <WH120> the better <WH3148> ?

For who knoweth <WH3045> <WH8802> what is good <WH2896> for man <WH120> in this life <WH2416>, all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his vain <WH1892> life <WH2416> which he spendeth <WH6213> <WH8799> as a shadow <WH6738>? for who can tell <WH5046> <WH8686> a man <WH120> what shall be after <WH310> him under the sun <WH8121> ?
